title: Annual Jamaica Scholarship
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers annual scholarships to first-year university students pursuing Bachelor's degrees at the University of the West Indies or the University of Technology.  Successful candidates must sign a bond to work in a Jamaican government institution for up to five years.
eligibility: First-year university students

Born in Jamaica and domiciled in Jamaica for five years prior to the award OR born overseas to Jamaican citizens and domiciled in Jamaica for five years prior to the award OR naturalized and domiciled in Jamaica for five years prior to the award (short absences disregarded)

Pass at least three core subjects at the CAPE level plus Communications Studies/Caribbean Studies in the preceding year's Caribbean Examination Council exams (both units of core subjects must be taken)
Under 19 years old on June 1st of the qualifying examination year
Good character
Provide required documentation
required_documents: Certified copy of birth certificate or evidence of date of birth
Letter/evidence of eligibility (based on birthplace and residency)
Character reference letter
One academic reference letter
Certificate of fitness from a registered medical practitioner
Certified copies of educational records/certificates
For Jamaica Centenary Scholarship (Female): Certificate or letter showing attendance at a public primary school (Infant School excluded) for at least three years
for_whom: First-year university students;  Jamaica Centenary Scholarship (Female) specifically mentions female applicants who attended public primary school for at least three years
fields_of_study: Bachelor's Degree in any faculty at the University of the West Indies or the University of Technology.

title: Emancipation Scholarship
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Emancipation Scholarship, offered by the Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth, is for Jamaican undergraduate students pursuing a Bachelor's degree at the University of the West Indies or the University of Technology.  Successful candidates will be required to sign a bond to work in Jamaica for a period not exceeding five years.
eligibility: Jamaican citizens, domiciled in Jamaica during the last five years.
Under twenty five (25) years old on the first of August 1st in the year of the award.
Pursuing or about to pursue full-time undergraduate study at the University of Technology or the University of the West Indies.
required_documents: Two (2) recent passport size photographs.
Certified copy of your birth certificate or evidence of date of birth.
Certificate of domicile signed by a J.P. or Minister of Religion or other reputable member of the community.
Certificate of fitness from a Registered Medical Practitioner.
Certificate of Character signed by member of the community e.g. Education Officer, Principal, Minister of Religion or Justice of the Peace.
Letter of reference: Academic/Professional.
Certified copies of Educational Qualification and current progress report if attending University.
Evidence of acceptance/application at U.W.I. or U-Tech.
Letter of approval from Chief Personnel Officer (in case of applicants in the Civil Service).
fields_of_study: Any Bachelor Degree in any Faculty at the University of the West Indies and the University of Technology.

title: UTECH Open Scholarship
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaican Ministry of Education and Youth offers the UTECH Open Scholarship to Jamaican university students pursuing a Bachelor's degree at the University of Technology, Jamaica.  Successful recipients must sign a bond to work in a Jamaican government institution for up to five years.
eligibility: Desirous of pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree at the University of Technology, Jamaica.
Must have applied to UTech for admission.
Must have resided in Jamaica for the last three consecutive years.
required_documents: Certified copy of birth certificate or evidence of date of birth
A statement written by a reputable community member attesting to residency in Jamaica for the last three years
Two passport-size photographs
One copy of statement (not more than 200 words)
Valid evidence of acceptance/registration at the University of Technology
Character reference letter from a community member (e.g., Education Officer, Principal, Minister of Religion, or Justice of the Peace)
Letter of reference: Academic/Professional
Letter of approval from Chief Personnel Officer or representative (for Civil Service applicants)
Certified copies of educational certificates/diplomas and a current progress report (if attending University)
fields_of_study: Any faculty at the University of Technology, Jamaica

title: Jamaica Technical High School Scholarship
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Technical High School Scholarship, offered by the Ministry of Education and Youth, provides funding for Jamaican students in their final year of technical high school to pursue undergraduate studies at the University of Technology. Successful candidates must sign a bond to work in a government institution in Jamaica for up to five years.
eligibility: Jamaican citizen, domiciled in Jamaica during the last five years.
A final year student at a Technical High School desirous of pursuing full-time undergraduate studies at the University of Technology.
required_documents: Certificate of domicile signed by a J.P. or Minister of Religion or other reputable member of the community.
A Character Reference Letter from a member of the community e.g. Education Officer, Principal, Minister of Religion or Justice of the Peace.
One (1) Academic Reference Letter.
Certificate of fitness signed by a Registered Medical Practitioner.
Applicants should make their own application to the University of Technology for admission.
for_whom: Final year students at a Technical High School
fields_of_study: Bachelor Degree in any Faculty at the University of Technology.

title: Elias A. Issa Scholarship (Female)
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Elias A. Issa Scholarship, offered by the Issa Foundation and the Ministry of Education and Youth, provides funding for Jamaican women pursuing undergraduate studies in Management Studies at UWI or Business Administration at UTech.  Successful applicants must sign a bond agreeing to work in a Jamaican government institution for up to five years.
eligibility: Jamaican citizens, domiciled in Jamaica during the last five (5) years
Not older than 25 years old on October 1st in the year of award
Pursuing or about to pursue full-time undergraduate study at the University of the West Indies or the University of Technology, Jamaica
required_documents: Two (2) recent passport size photographs
Certified copy of your birth certificate or evidence of date of birth
Certificate of domicile signed by a Justice of the Peace (JP), Minister of Religion or other reputable member of the community
Certificate of fitness from a Registered Medical Practitioner
Certificate of Character signed by a member of the community e.g. Education Officer, Principal, Minister of Religion or Justice of the Peace
Letter of reference: Academic/Professional
Certified copies of Educational certificates obtained and a progress report if attending University
Evidence of acceptance at UWI or UTECH Jamaica

title: Specialized Scholarships
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaican Ministry of Education and Youth offers specialized scholarships to first and second-year college students pursuing Bachelor's degrees in specific education fields or approved programs.  Recipients are bonded to teach in government institutions (education programs) or work in Jamaica (other programs) for five years.
eligibility: First and second year college students
Pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Secondary Mathematics Education, Science Education, or Technical Vocational Education
Pursuing programmes of study approved under the programme
required_documents: Valid evidence of Acceptance/Registration Letter from the institution (must be available at interview)
Certified copies of transcripts or certificates
Two (2) Reference Letters
Two (2) Passport size photographs
Certified copy of Birth Certificate
Valid TRN

source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The In-Service Teacher Upgrade Programme, offered by the Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth, provides professional development opportunities for teachers.  Applicants must submit several documents including an acceptance letter from their chosen institution and a principal's recommendation.
required_documents: An acceptance letter from your institution of choice
1 Passport sized photo
Certified copies of existing degrees/certificates
A recommendation from your principal

source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers the GC Foster Physical Scholarship to first and second-year undergraduate students pursuing approved Bachelor's degrees in various fields, including education and sports-related disciplines.  Recipients are bonded to work in Jamaica for five years after graduation (for non-education fields).
eligibility: First and second year college students
Pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Secondary Mathematics Education, Science Education, or Technical Vocational Education
Pursuing programmes of study approved under the programme
required_documents: Valid evidence of Acceptance/Registration Letter from the institution you applied to (must be available at interview)
Certified copies of transcripts or certificates
Two (2) Reference Letters
Two (2) Passport size photographs
Certified copy of Birth Certificate
Valid TRN

description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers scholarships to first and second-year community college students pursuing Bachelor's degrees in specific education and technical fields.  Recipients are bonded to work in Jamaica for five years after graduation (five years in a Jamaican Government Educational Institution if studying education).
eligibility: First and second-year college students
Desirous of pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Secondary Mathematics Education, Science Education, or Technical Vocational Education
Pursuing programmes of study approved under the programme
required_documents: Valid evidence of Acceptance/Registration Letter from the institution (must be available at interview)
Certified copies of transcripts or certificates
Two (2) Reference Letters
Two (2) Passport size photographs
Certified copy of Birth Certificate

Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers scholarships for Master's degrees in Educational Psychology, Clinical Psychology, Occupational Therapy, and Speech Therapy.  Successful candidates will be bonded to work in Jamaica for up to five years and must maintain a minimum GPA of 3.0.
required_documents: Valid evidence of Acceptance/Registration Letter from the institution you applied
Certified copies of transcripts or certificates
Two (2) Reference Letters
One (1) Passport size photograph
Certified copy of Birth Certificate
Valid TRN

title: Early Childhood Teacher
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers scholarships to early childhood teachers and caregivers in Jamaica.  The scholarships fund Bachelor's degrees in Early Childhood Education or the HEART NCTVET Early Childhood Associate Degree Programme.  Recipients are bonded to teach in Jamaica's education system for up to five years.
eligibility: Basic School Teachers in Private-Public Grant-in-Aid Basic Schools
Caregivers in Infant Schools and Infant Departments
Desirous of pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Early Childhood Education, or the HEART NCTVET Early Childhood Associate Degree Programme
required_documents: Valid evidence of Acceptance/Registration Letter from the institution you applied to
Certified copies of transcripts or certificates
Two (2) Reference Letters
One (1) Passport size photograph
Certified copy of Birth Certificate
Valid TRN
for_whom: Basic School Teachers in Private-Public Grant-in-Aid Basic Schools and Caregivers in Infant Schools and Infant Departments

title: Financial Assistance Grant
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth offers a Financial Assistance Grant for full-time students at UCJ-approved tertiary institutions.  Applicants must meet specific age, GPA, and employment requirements, and provide various supporting documents for application processing.
eligibility: Applicant must be between the age 18 - 35 years on or before December 31 in the year of application
Applicant must be a Full Time student at a UCJ approved tertiary institution.
Applicants must have a GPA of 2.2 or above.
Only government and non-profit organizations are approved for this component.
required_documents: Letter of acceptance (new students only)
Status letter (continuing students)
Progress Report (Transcript) - continuing students only
Evidence of outstanding balances or tuition fees (must be obtained from institution)
Job Letter (If Employed)
Certified copy of Passport sized photograph
Certified copy of birth certificate
Certified copy of TRN
Evidence of need – reference letter from two referees (Principal or teacher, Pastor, Guidance Counsellor or representative from Student Support Services, Member of Parliament, Justice of the Peace)

title: Jamaica Values and Attitudes Programme
source_name: Jamaica Ministry of Education and Youth
application_process: *Students awaiting CSEC, CAPE and acceptance letters from their institution of choice will be provisionally processed pending the release of their results. Submission of all other documents must be done by June 30.*Continuing students without transcripts, statement of fees and status letters may submit all outstanding documents by June 30.If you have further questions or concerns you may send an email to the respective emails as follows:JAMVAT - jamvat@moey.gov.jmFinancial Assistance/Grants - grants@moey.gov.jmAll scholarships and Inservice inquiries - scholarships@moey.gov.jm
description: The Jamaica Values and Attitudes (JAMVAT) Programme offers financial assistance to tertiary students facing tuition challenges.  In return for 200 hours of public service, students receive up to $350,000 towards their tuition (30% of total tuition).
eligibility: Be between the ages of 18 & 35 on or before December 31 of the year of application.
Be a Full Time student.
Have a GPA of 2.5 or above.
Complete 200 service hours upon approval.
required_documents: Details of TWO potential work placement sites (with signatures and stamps)
Certified copy of Birth Certificate/Valid ID and TRN
Certified copy of acceptance letter (new students, no more than 6 months old)
Status letter and official transcript with proof of GPA (returning students, no more than 6 months old)
Tuition letter
Passport Size Picture
for_whom: Tertiary students who qualify for admission but are financially challenged
